div.a: Does Free Speech On The Internet Actually Exist?

div.div: As more and more speech takes place on the internet, the answer becomes more and more important: the future of free speech might have more to do with corporate censorship than the First Amendment.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TGYoGs&via=Digg&text=Does Free Speech On The Internet Actually Exist?

div.a: Watch People Be Born And Die In (Simulated) Real-Time

div.div: Here's a visualization of simulated deaths and births in the U.S. presented in real-time. (Note: This is hosted on a Google Drive and might crash by the time you get to it)

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YH0hJ6&via=Digg&text=Watch People Be Born And Die In (Simulated) Real-Time

div.a: 18 Photos Taken At Just The Right Angle

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VkuI11&via=Digg&text=18 Photos Taken At Just The Right Angle

div.a: NYC Wants To Reinvent The Payphone With Your Help

div.div: The City of New York is hosting Reinvent Payphones, a public design challenge that seeks to rally urban designers, planners, technologists and policy experts to create physical and/or virtual prototypes that imagine the future of payphones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SEJmmX&via=Digg&text=NYC Wants To Reinvent The Payphone With Your Help

div.div: Research shows which gifts people actually appreciate.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11NN4gH&via=Digg&text=The Science Behind Gifting

div.a: Stunning Color Photographs Of Paris From 1914

div.div: Albert Kahn sent photographers all over the world in the early 1900s and amassed over 72,000 color photos in the process. Here are a few shots of his from Paris on the eve of World War I.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WH7i7d&via=Digg&text=Stunning Color Photographs Of Paris From 1914

div.a: A Genius Investor Thinks Billions Of People Are Going To Starve To Death — Here's Why

div.div: Investor Jeremy Grantham recently published a startlingly depressing piece about the future of humanity. Have the number of people on Earth finally outstripped the planet's ability to support us?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QEEyOz&via=Digg&text=A Genius Investor Thinks Billions Of People Are Going To Starve To Death — Here's Why

div.div: To the other men in his Free Syrian Army unit, he’s simply known as the Sniper, a 21-year-old army-trained sharpshooter who defected on Feb. 21 and joined their ranks. Few of his colleagues know his first name let alone his surname — and that’s the way he wants to keep it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TF4AAS&via=Digg&text=Confessions Of A Sniper

div.a: This Restaurant Plays Audio Clips Of The Worst Yelp Reviews For Bathroom Patrons

div.div: Craft & Commerce, a gastropub located in San Diego, has chosen the more forward approach and taken to playing audio clips of their best worst Yelp reviews while patrons do their business in the bathroom.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R5xFXT&via=Digg&text=This Restaurant Plays Audio Clips Of The Worst Yelp Reviews For Bathroom Patrons

div.a: Tech-Company Holiday Party Invitations, As We Imagine Them

div.div: Wired dreamed up a few holiday party invitations from some of the biggest names in technology. Like a snowflake, each is unique to the company and where it stands in the market. Unlike a snowflake, Wired made them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VyCy9s&via=Digg&text=Tech-Company Holiday Party Invitations, As We Imagine Them

div.div: AREN'T THEY SUPPOSED TO BE NEUTRAL

div.a: Swiss Spy Compromises CIA And MI6 Secrets

div.div: Secret information on counter-terrorism shared by foreign governments may have been compromised by a massive data theft by a senior IT technician for the NDB, Switzerland's intelligence service, European national security sources said.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R45cls&via=Digg&text=Swiss Spy Compromises CIA And MI6 Secrets

div.a: Landmark Study Shows How Social Media Has Revolutionized Our Toilet Habits

div.div: A new Nielsen study has discovered a "paradigm shift in how Americans use the bathroom."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VkAiR7&via=Digg&text=Landmark Study Shows How Social Media Has Revolutionized Our Toilet Habits

div.a: Snake On A Plane Forces Emergency Landing

div.div: Ninety passengers aboard an Egypt Air flight from Cairo to Kuwait could have used actor Samuel L. Jackson this week after a snake reportedly bit a Jordanian man who smuggled the reptile onboard.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SL2IFb&via=Digg&text=Snake On A Plane Forces Emergency Landing

div.div: Maybe Nickelback should perform this parody of "Look At This Photograph" and nothing else, ever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sv8k6X&via=Digg&text=Look At This Instagram (Nickelback Parody)

div.div: JAY-Z JUST KEEPS GETTING MORE AWESOME

div.a: Jay-Z Adorably Explains Who He Is To An Adorable Old Lady On The Subway

div.div: In part of a documentary on his performance at Brooklyn's Barclays Center, Jay-Z explains to an old lady on the subway who he is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SKWeq5&via=Digg&text=Jay-Z Adorably Explains Who He Is To An Adorable Old Lady On The Subway

div.a: Portraits Of People Wearing Space Suits In Not-So-Alien Locations

div.div: For his project titled “Alienation,” Italian photographer Graziano Panfili shot portraits of ordinary people wearing space suits in ordinary locations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vyfwjf&via=Digg&text=Portraits Of People Wearing Space Suits In Not-So-Alien Locations

div.div: BECAUSE YOU DEFINITELY STILL HAVE ONE

div.a: Play 'Portal' On Your TI-83 Graphing Calculator

div.div: As if you needed more distractions from class, Reddit user Builderboy2005 has created his own version of Valve's hit game Portal for use on TI-83 and TI-84 calculators.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TH3W3C&via=Digg&text=Play 'Portal' On Your TI-83 Graphing Calculator

div.div: Here are the five steps to a successful banking-fraud heist.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11yrDRF&via=Digg&text=How To Rob A Bank

div.a: Former Microsoftie Plans High-End Marijuana Business

div.div: Now that marijuana will soon become legal in Washington state, a former Microsoft product manager has big dreams of entering the retail marjiuana business.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vti9mi&via=Digg&text=Former Microsoftie Plans High-End Marijuana Business

div.div: IT'S LIKE GETTING SOCKS FOR CHRISTMAS

div.a: The Jackpot In This Lottery Is... A Job?

div.div: With the Italian economy in its fourth recession in the last ten years and unemployment soaring, a supermarket has come up with a novel way of hiring. They're hosting a job lottery.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YwoNOi&via=Digg&text=The Jackpot In This Lottery Is... A Job?

div.a: Golda Meir's Chicken Soup Recipe Released After 30 Years

div.div: Former prime minister Golda Meir’s chicken soup recipe was recorded by the national archives more than 30 years ago, and was released for the to the public for the first time on Tuesday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzFtkB&via=Digg&text=Golda Meir's Chicken Soup Recipe Released After 30 Years

div.a: Million Days Lost To Diarrhea Spur Military’s Search For Cure

div.div: The elite Pentagon research unit that helped create the Internet and stealth fighter jets is now taking on diarrhea.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WHlTzu&via=Digg&text=Million Days Lost To Diarrhea Spur Military’s Search For Cure

div.a: Fake Facebook Propaganda Posters Encourage Employees To Switch To Android

div.div: Without mandating a switch from on high, Facebook strongly urged its employees in August to swap their iPhones for Android devices. Here are some over-the-top propaganda posters encouraging the switch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ywm8Eh&via=Digg&text=Fake Facebook Propaganda Posters Encourage Employees To Switch To Android

div.a: The Most Disgusting Episode Of Hoarders Or Any Show Ever Probably

div.div: If the headline isn't enough of a warning, here's another: the video above is disgusting and disturbing. Proceed with caution and without food in your mouth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11zj214&via=Digg&text=The Most Disgusting Episode Of Hoarders Or Any Show Ever Probably

div.div: WE THOUGHT WE WERE THE ONLY 'CREATIVE' ONES

Describing yourself to a potential employer can be an excruciating challenge: you have to hit all the generic key points while still sounding unique. "To me, the box is a lot bigger than it is to most people—and I’m still thinking outside of it!" Or something like that.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WHgs3F&via=Digg&text=The World According To LinkedIn

div.div: poor man not poor enough to elicit sympathy nydailynews.com/new-york/h...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/StRncN&via=Digg&text=Barefoot Homeless Man Not Actually Homeless

div.a: The Tough Life Of A Coin

div.div: The life of a coin isn't exactly smooth. In fact, you can see evidence of pitting when you view coins through a high-powered microscope.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TDDeMl&via=Digg&text=The Tough Life Of A Coin

div.a: Google Launches New Gmail App For iPhone

div.div: Google just released an updated version of Gmail for iPhone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XmENRh&via=Digg&text=Google Launches New Gmail App For iPhone

div.a: Matt Damon Cracks 'Salad Tossing' Joke On 'The Today Show'

div.div: Some good food advice peppered with some adult humor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SvgiNc&via=Digg&text=Matt Damon Cracks 'Salad Tossing' Joke On 'The Today Show'

div.a: Is It Racist To Call Someone An Australian?

div.div: An international incident sheds light on the trans-Tasman rivalry with New Zealand and the limits of criminalizing speech.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vr7Hj4&via=Digg&text=Is It Racist To Call Someone An Australian?

div.div: COME ON, WE COULDN'T GET A FLYING CAR FIRST?

div.a: Volvo Plans To Make The Self-Driving Car A Reality By 2014

div.div: Long hailed as one of the safest car producers in the world, Volvo hopes to retain that reputation by introducing vehicles that can avoid passenger injuries on their own by the year 2020. Its plans hinge on eliminating the largest cause of road accidents -- the drivers themselves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UCKUyp&via=Digg&text=Volvo Plans To Make The Self-Driving Car A Reality By 2014
